testsuite.description: This testsuite is designed to verify the GetLaboratoryOrderOutcome contract.

testcase.description:
Verifies that the response is schema- and schematron- valid and contains data for the requested patient only.
The only requirement on test data is that there is some data for the given patientId. It might be a good idea to start by executing this testcase for a patient with a very simple response and when that works switch to a patient with more complex data.

Verifies that the result only contains information within the date boundaries for the given patient. The rule is
"Begränsning av sökningen i tid, vilket innebär att endast svar returneras där det finns i en tidpunkt angiven i någon av i svaret ingående analysis/analysisTime, eller om sådan tid ej finns i svaret (beroende på att det inte inkluderar analyssvar) tidpunkten angiven i documentTime, som liger helt eller delvis inom det sökta tidsintervallet."
Additional information about failed assertions can be found in the script log. The test is best performed for a patient that has the following LaboratoryOutcome-elements:
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and at least one Analysis where AnalysisTime starts before and ends after the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and at least one Analysis where AnalysisTime starts before and ends within the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and at least one Analysis where AnalysisTime starts within and ends after the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and at least one Analysis where AnalysisTime starts and ends within the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and at least one Analysis with only AnalysisTime start or end given and within the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime inside the given range and without any matching analysis time
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and the AnalysisTime (both start and end) for all analyses before the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and the AnalysisTime (both start and end) for all analyses after the given range.
A laboratoryOutcome with DocumentTime outside the given range, and only AnalysisTime start given, before or after the given range.
The expected DocumentId's, case 1-6 above, must be added as a comma-separated list in the expectedDocumentIds field.
The unexpected DocumentId's, case 7-9 above, must be added as a comma-separated list in the unexpectedDocumentIds field.
The fields httpHeaderHsaId and logicalAddress must contain values that do not limit the response.

Verifies that the result only contains information for a single CareContactId.
Enter a PatientId, two CareContactIds and sourceSystemHSAid that exist in the source system.
The fields httpHeaderHsaId and logicalAddress must contain values that do not affect the returned list.

Verifies that the service returns an empty result instead of a Soap Fault if a nonexistent PatientId is given.
Enter a PatientId that is not found in the source system and valid values for httpHeaderHsaId and logical adress.

Verifies that the service returns an empty result instead of a Soap Fault if a nonexistent CareContactId is given.
Enter a PatientId that exists in the source system and a CareContactId and sourceSystemHSAid that is not found in the source system.
The fields httpHeaderHsaId and logicalAddress must contain values that do not affect the returned list.
This testcase is not implemented, needs to be clarified.

The test verifies that the source system returns a Soap Fault if careContactId has a value and sourceSystemHSAid is empty or not supplied.
Enter a PatientId/CareContactId-combination that exists in the source system and valid values for httpHeaderHsaId and logical address.

The test verifies that the source system returns a Soap Fault if the logicalAddress and sourceSystemHSAid are not the same.
Enter PatientId and a CareContactId and the correct SourceSystemHSAid of a CareContact that is found in the source system.
The field logicalAddress must NOT match SourceSystemHSAid.
The field httpHeaderHsaId must contain a valid value.
